intro: Borreria mitracarpoides, commonly known as the Mexican mountain borage, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly serrated edge. Borreria mitracarpoides is typically found in rocky or arid environments, adapting to dry conditions with its succulent-like foliage.
